metadata.Title: CVE-2022-36314 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
When opening a Windows shortcut from the local filesystem, an attacker could supply a remote path that would lead to unexpected network requests from the operating system.
This bug only affects Firefox for Windows. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 102.1, Firefox < 103, and Thunderbird < 102.1. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-36314` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: thunderbird - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.3.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
